data_table.description: TIA/Stroke, Exam 2. Participants with or without atherosclerosis and cardiovascular disease and involved in the "Atherosclerosis Risk in Communities (ARIC) Cohort" project.

variable.name: TIACFLAG
variable.description: =1 if form is present [TIA/Stroke, exam 2]

variable.name: TIACCY
variable.description: Contact year [4] [TIA/Stroke, exam 2]

variable.name: TIAC01
variable.description: [Medical history]. Since the last ARIC visit, have you been told by a physician that you had a stroke, slight stroke, transient ischemic attack or transient ischemic attack [TIA]? Q1 [TIA/Stroke, exam 2]

variable.name: TIAC02
variable.description: [Medical history]. During this time, when did the (first) stroke or transient ischemic attack [TIA] occur? Q2 [TIA/Stroke, exam 2]

variable.name: TIAC03
variable.description: [Sudden loss or change of speech]. Since the last ARIC visit, have you had any sudden loss or changes in speech? Q3 [TIA/Stroke, exam 2]

variable.name: TIAC04
variable.description: [Sudden loss or change of speech]. During this time, how many episodes of loss or changes in speech have you had? Q4 [TIA/Stroke, exam 2]
variable.value: More than 20, or frequent, intermittent events, too numerous to count

variable.name: TIAC05
variable.description: [Sudden loss or change of speech]. During this same time period when did the earliest occur? Q5 [TIA/Stroke, exam 2]
variable.value: Greater than 6 months, but less than 1 year
Greater than 1 year, but less than 2 years
Greater than 2 years, but less than 3 years ago

variable.name: TIAC06
variable.description: [Sudden loss or change of speech]. How long did It (the longest episode) last? Q6 [TIA/Stroke, exam 2]
variable.value: At least 30 seconds, but less than 1 minute
At least 1 minute, but less than 3 minutes
At Least 3 minutes, but less than 1 hour
At least 1 hour, but less than 6 hours
At least 6 hours, but Less than 12 hours

variable.name: TIAC07
variable.description: [Sudden loss or change of speech]. Did the (worst) episode come on suddenly? Q7 [TIA/Stroke, exam 2]

variable.name: TIAC07A
variable.description: [Sudden loss or change of speech]. How long did it take for the symptoms to get as bad as they were going to get? Q7A [TIA/Stroke, exam 2]
variable.value: At least 3 seconds, but less than a minute
At least 1 minute, but less than 1 hour
At least 1 hour, but less than 2 hours
At least 2 hours, but less than 24 hours

variable.name: TIAC08A
variable.description: [Sudden loss or change of speech]. Do any of the following describe your change in speech? Slurred speech like you were drunk. Q8A [TIA/Stroke, exam 2]

variable.name: TIAC08B
variable.description: [Sudden loss or change of speech]. Do any of the following describe your change in speech? Could talk but the wrong words came out. Q8B [TIA/Stroke, exam 2]

variable.name: TIAC08C
variable.description: [Sudden loss or change of speech]. Do any of the following describe your change in speech? Knew what you wanted to say, but the words would not come out. Q8C [TIA/Stroke, exam 2]

variable.name: TIAC09A
variable.description: [Sudden loss or change of speech]. While you were having your (worst) episode of change in speech, did any of the following occur? Numbness or tingling. Q9A [TIA/Stroke, exam 2]

variable.name: TIAC09B
variable.description: [Sudden loss or change of speech]. Did you have difficulty on. Q9B [TIA/Stroke, exam 2]

variable.name: TIAC09C
variable.description: [Sudden loss or change of speech]. While you were having your (worst) episode of change in speech, did any of the following occur? Paralysis or weakness? Q9C [TIA/Stroke, exam 2]

variable.name: TIAC09D
variable.description: [Sudden loss or change of speech]. Did you have difficulty on. Q9D [TIA/Stroke, exam 2]

variable.name: TIAC09E
variable.description: [Sudden loss or change of speech]. While you were having your (worst) episode of change in speech, did any of the following occur? Lightheaded or dizzy spells? Q9E [TIA/Stroke, exam 2]

variable.name: TIAC09F
variable.description: [Sudden loss or change of speech]. While you were having your (worst) episode of change in speech, did any of the following occur? Blackouts or fainting? Q9F [TIA/Stroke, exam 2]

variable.name: TIAC09G
variable.description: [Sudden loss or change of speech]. While you were having your (worst) episode of change in speech, did any of the following occur? Seizures or convulsions? Q9G [TIA/Stroke, exam 2]

variable.name: TIAC09H
variable.description: [Sudden loss or change of speech]. While you were having your (worst) episode of change in speech, did any of the following occur? Headache? Q9H [TIA/Stroke, exam 2]

variable.name: TIAC09I
variable.description: [Sudden loss or change of speech]. While you were having your (worst) episode of change in speech, did any of the following occur? Visual disturbances? Q9I [TIA/Stroke, exam 2]

variable.name: TIAC09J
variable.description: [Sudden loss or change of speech]. Did you have.. Q9J [TIA/Stroke, exam 2]
variable.value: Vision loss in right eye only
Vision loss in left eye only
Total loss of vision in both eyes
Trouble in both eyes seeing to the right
Trouble in both eyes seeing to the left

variable.name: TIAC10
variable.description: [Sudden loss of vision]. Since the last ARIC visit, have you ever had any sudden loss of vision, complete or partial? Q10 [TIA/Stroke, exam 2]

variable.name: TIAC11
variable.description: [Sudden loss of vision]. During this time, how many episodes of loss of vision have you had? Q11 [TIA/Stroke, exam 2]
variable.value: More than 20, or frequent, intermittent events, too numerous to count

variable.name: TIAC12
variable.description: [Sudden loss of vision]. During this same time period when did the earliest occur? Q12 [TIA/Stroke, exam 2]
variable.value: Greater than 6 months, but less than 1 year
Greater than 1 year, but less than 2 years
Greater than 2 years, but Less than 3 years ago

variable.name: TIAC13
variable.description: [Sudden loss of vision]. How long did it (the longest episode) last? Q13 [TIA/Stroke, exam 2]
variable.value: At least 30 seconds, but less than 1 minute
At least 1 minute, but less than 3 minutes
At least 3 minutes, but less than 1 hour
At least 1 hour, but less than 6 hours
At least 6 hours, but less than 12 hours
At least 12 hours, but Less than 24 hours

variable.name: TIAC14
variable.description: [Sudden loss of vision]. Did the (worst) episode come on suddenly? Q14 [TIA/Stroke, exam 2]

variable.name: TIAC14A
variable.description: [Sudden loss of vision]. How long did it take for the symptoms to get as bad as they were going to get? Q14A [TIA/Stroke, exam 2]
variable.value: At least 3 seconds, but less than a minute
At least 1 minute, but less than 1 hour
At least 1 hour, but less than 2 hours
At least 2 hours, but less than 24 hours

variable.name: TIAC15
variable.description: [Sudden loss of vision]. During the (worst) episode, which of the following parts of your vision were affected? Q15 [TIA/Stroke, exam 2]

variable.name: TIAC15A
variable.description: [Sudden loss of vision]. Did you have.. Q15A [TIA/Stroke, exam 2]
variable.value: Total loss of vision in both eyes

variable.name: TIAC16A
variable.description: [Sudden loss of vision]. While you were having your (worst episode of) loss of vision, did any of the following occur? Speech disturbance. Q16A [TIA/Stroke, exam 2]

variable.name: TIAC16B
variable.description: [Sudden loss of vision]. While you were having your (worst episode of) loss of vision, did any of the following occur? Numbness or tingling. Q16B [TIA/Stroke, exam 2]

variable.name: TIAC16C
variable.description: [Sudden loss of vision]. Did you have difficulty on. Q16C [TIA/Stroke, exam 2]

variable.name: TIAC16D
variable.description: [Sudden loss of vision]. While you were having your (worst episode of) loss of vision, did any of the following occur? Paralysis or weakness [TIA/Stroke, exam 2]

variable.name: TIAC16E
variable.description: [Sudden loss of vision]. Did you have difficulty on. Q16E [TIA/Stroke, exam 2]

variable.name: TIAC16F
variable.description: [Sudden loss of vision]. While you were having your (worst episode of) loss of vision, did any of the following occur? Lightheadedness or dizzy spells. Q16F [TIA/Stroke, exam 2]

variable.name: TIAC16G
variable.description: [Sudden loss of vision]. While you were having your (worst episode of) loss of vision, did any of the following occur? Blackouts or fainting. Q16G [TIA/Stroke, exam 2]

variable.name: TIAC16H
variable.description: [Sudden loss of vision]. While you were Having your (worst episode of) loss of vision, did any of the following occur? Seizures or convulsions. Q16H [TIA/Stroke, exam 2]

variable.name: TIAC16I
variable.description: [Sudden loss of vision]. While you were having your (worst episode of) loss of vision, did any of the following occur? Headache. Q16I [TIA/Stroke, exam 2]

variable.name: TIAC17
variable.description: [Double vision]. Since the last ARIC visit, have you had a sudden spell of double vision? Q17 [TIA/Stroke, exam 2]

variable.name: TIAC17A
variable.description: [Sudden loss of vision]. If you closed one eye, did the double vision go away? Q17A [TIA/Stroke, exam 2]

variable.name: TIAC18
variable.description: [Sudden loss of vision]. During this time, how many episodes of double vision have you had? Q18 [TIA/Stroke, exam 2]
variable.value: More than 20, or frequent, intermittent events, too numerous to count

variable.name: TIAC19
variable.description: [Sudden loss of vision]. During the same time period, when did the earliest occur? Q19 [TIA/Stroke, exam 2]
variable.value: Greater than 6 months, but less than 1 year
Greater than 1 year, but less than 2 years
Greater than 2 years, but Less than 3 years ago

variable.description: [Sudden loss of vision]. How long did It (the longest episode) Last? Q20 [TIA/Stroke, exam 2]
variable.value: At least 30 seconds, but less than 1 minute

variable.name: TIAC23
variable.description: [Sudden numbness or tingling]. Since the last ARIC visit, have you had sudden numbness, tingling, or loss of feeling on one side of your body? Q23 [TIA/Stroke, exam 2]

variable.name: TIAC24
variable.description: [Sudden numbness or tingling]. Did the feeling of numbness or tingling occur only when you kept your arms or legs in a certain position? Q24 [TIA/Stroke, exam 2]

variable.name: TIAC25
variable.description: [Sudden numbness or tingling]. During this time, how many episodes of numbness, tingling, or loss of sensation have you had? Q25 [TIA/Stroke, exam 2]
variable.value: More than 20, or frequent, intermittent events, too numerous to count

variable.description: [Sudden numbness or tingling]. During this same time period, when did the earliest occur? Q26 [TIA/Stroke, exam 2]
variable.value: Greater than 6 months, but less than 1 year

Greater than 2 years, but less than 3 years ago
